world.name: Sinister Lane
world.description: A narrow, grimy lane of sagging houses and leaning streetlamps. Crows sometimes perch on the wires. It connects Mr. Olivander’s dilapidated home to Judge Strausson’s tidy townhouse.

world.name: Mr. Olivander: Front Steps
world.description: Cracked concrete steps with flaking paint and an eye symbol chalked on the stoop. The door hangs crooked on its hinges.

world.name: Mr. Olivander: Living Room
world.description: A cluttered, dusty room used for ill-rehearsed theater productions; mismatched chairs, stained curtains, and the faint smell of cold soup.

world.name: Mr. Olivander: Kitchen
world.description: Greasy counters and a leaning icebox. Knives are dull, pots dented; children are expected to cook elaborate meals here.

items.name: Dull Knife
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Mr. Olivander: Kitchen, you notice a Dull Knife where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Dented Pot
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Mr. Olivander: Kitchen, you notice a Dented Pot where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Greasy Apron
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Mr. Olivander: Kitchen, you notice a Greasy Apron where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Mr. Olivander: Tower
world.description: A narrow, drafty tower with barred windows and a rope coil. It is more prison than bedroom.

items.name: Coil of Rope
items.notice: While adjusting to the light in Mr. Olivander: Tower, you spot a Coil of Rope hanging from a hook near the shadows.

items.name: Barred Window
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Mr. Olivander: Tower, you notice a Barred Window where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Old Curtain
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Mr. Olivander: Tower, you notice a Old Curtain where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Mr. Olivander: Backyard Garden
world.description: A scraggly patch of weeds, broken statuary, and a rickety fence painted with a staring eye.

world.name: Judge Strausson: Garden
world.description: Neatly trimmed hedges, a cobblestone path, and a small arbor dripping with vines—an oasis beside the squalor next door.

world.name: Judge Strausson: Library
world.description: Warm light on rows of well-loved books, a ladder on rails, and a cushioned reading window that smells faintly of tea.

items.name: Law Book
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Judge Strausson: Library, you notice a Law Book where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Dictionary
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Judge Strausson: Library, you notice a Dictionary where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Rolling Ladder
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Judge Strausson: Library, you notice a Rolling Ladder where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

npcs.name: Judge Strausson
npcs.dialogue: Oh, my dears! Take any book, but mind the index.
npcs.flavor: She adjusts her glasses and smiles whenever you handle books gently.

world.name: City Street
world.description: A busier avenue with shops with ‘IN’ and ‘OUT’ signs switching by the week; leads to apartments and public transit.

world.name: Regional Rail Junction
world.description: A soot-smudged platform web where many uncertain journeys begin; lines stretch toward towns, mountains, and the lake.

world.name: Country Road
world.description: A gravel road bordered by fields and the occasional heron. It connects the city to a warm, herpetological home.

world.name: Dr. Montrose: Foyer
world.description: Coat pegs, rubber boots by the door, and the comforting sense that science may yet be kind.

npcs.name: Dr. Montgomery
npcs.dialogue: Science is a lamp in a very dark room. Mind the snakes.
npcs.flavor: His eyes light up at proper fieldwork and labeled jars.

world.name: Dr. Montrose: Reptile Room
world.description: Steam-warm air hugs rows of terrariums: snakes slither, frogs blink, and specimen jars glint with labels in tidy handwriting.

items.name: Specimen Jar
items.notice: A chemical tang in Dr. Montrose: Reptile Room draws you to a shelf where a Specimen Jar sits half-concealed.

check.notes: Chemical smell or labels can guide you.

items.name: Grabber Tool
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Dr. Montrose: Reptile Room, you notice a Grabber Tool where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Field Notes
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Dr. Montrose: Reptile Room, you notice the edge of a Field Notes that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

world.name: Dr. Montrose: Kitchen
world.description: A bright kitchen with citrus in a bowl and a kettle that always seems about to sing.

world.name: Dr. Montrose: Garden
world.description: Stamped-earth paths around banana trees and netted pens where unusual lizards sun themselves.

world.name: Clifftop Path
world.description: Wind-shaved limestone steps with a railing that screams in a storm. The path ends in a house that clings to the cliff.

world.name: Aunt Josephine (harbor (lakefront)): Living Room
world.description: A room of lace doilies and forbidding notices about every imaginable hazard; windows rattle over the grey lake.

world.name: Aunt Josephine (harbor (lakefront)): Kitchen
world.description: Appliances unplugged and labeled DANGEROUS; the pantry bulges with cold tins of food.

world.name: Aunt Josephine (harbor (lakefront)): Study
world.description: Towering grammar texts, a desk with perfectly sharpened pencils, and a dictionary set like an altar.

items.name: Grammar Text
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Aunt Josephine (harbor (lakefront)): Study, you notice a Grammar Text where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Fountain Pen
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Aunt Josephine (harbor (lakefront)): Study, you notice a Fountain Pen where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Dictionary
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Aunt Josephine (harbor (lakefront)): Study, you notice a Dictionary where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Aunt Josephine (harbor (lakefront)): Porch
world.description: A precarious porch jutting above the whitecaps of Lake Lachrymose.

world.name: Lake Lachrymose: lakeshore
world.description: Pebbly, windblown lakeshore with bleached driftwood and ominous ‘NO SWIMMING (LEECHES)’ signs.

items.name: Fishing Line
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Lake Lachrymose: lakeshore, you notice a Fishing Line where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Life Preserver
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Lake Lachrymose: lakeshore, you notice a Life Preserver where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Lake Lachrymose: Caves
world.description: Damp limestone hollows smelling of salt and secrets. Echoes do not always return the truth.

world.name: Coastal Road
world.description: A road that follows the gnashing line of surf; it bears tire ruts, crow prints, and uneasy memories.

world.name: Paltryville Road
world.description: A long, splintered road lined with billboards for gum and eyewear, all slightly crooked.

world.name: Lucky Smells: Mill Floor
world.description: Sawdust fog, shrieking blades, and the whisper of stamped coupons instead of wages.

items.name: Wood Shavings
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Lucky Smells: Mill Floor, you notice a Wood Shavings where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Coupon Book
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Lucky Smells: Mill Floor, you notice a Coupon Book where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Lucky Smells: Bunks
world.description: Rows of sagging beds with a single dangling bulb and the smell of wood glue.

world.name: Lucky Smells: Foreman Office
world.description: Metal desk, clipboard of punishments, and a window no one can see out of.

world.name: School Road
world.description: A cracked sidewalk bordered by thorny hedges and a sign that says Beatrice was here, which is not strictly helpful.

world.name: Prufrock: Entrance
world.description: Stone archway with the school crest: a mismatched pair of glasses and a frown.

world.name: Prufrock: Orphans’ Shack
world.description: A leaning hut with fungus in the corners and crabs under the bed. It does not pass any inspection worth having.

items.name: Fungus Sample
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Prufrock: Orphans’ Shack, you notice a Fungus Sample where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Broken Broom
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Prufrock: Orphans’ Shack, you notice a Broken Broom where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Prufrock: Library
world.description: Almost empty stacks, a shrieking librarian, and three books actually worth reading if you can find them.

world.name: Prufrock: Cafeteria
world.description: Grey porridge in grey bowls on grey trays. The cutlery is loud enough to be cruel.

world.name: Prufrock: Vice Principal Office
world.description: Nero’s violins are everywhere; detentions are posted like recital programs.

world.name: City Avenue of In/Out
world.description: A fashionable boulevard where citizens adopt trends before understanding them.

world.name: Squalor: Lobby
world.description: A cavernous lobby with ‘IN’ art installations and a concierge who takes messages but never delivers them.

items.name: Face Shield (Spare)
items.notice: You notice a Face Shield (Spare) tucked where anyone might find it.

items.name: Spare Rope
items.notice: A bellhop’s cart carries a neatly coiled rope.

world.name: Squalor: Elevator Shaft
world.description: A dark, empty void where elevators used to be. Cables hang like spider silk.

world.name: Squalor: Jerome & Esmé Apartment
world.description: Sprawling rooms full of ‘in’ items arranged impractically; windows look out onto rumors.

items.name: In-Style Magazine
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Squalor: Jerome & Esmé Apartment, you notice a In-Style Magazine where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Needlessly Long Cigarette Holder
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Squalor: Jerome & Esmé Apartment, you notice a Needlessly Long Cigarette Holder where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Crow Road
world.description: A road white with droppings at dawn when the crows lift, and black with birds at dusk when they return.

world.name: VFD Village: Town Square
world.description: Rule plaques on every post; a fountain surrounded by cawing spectators.

items.name: Temporary Work Permit
items.notice: You notice a Temporary Work Permit tucked where anyone might find it.

items.name: Temporary Work Permit
items.notice: A notice board has a Temporary Work Permit tucked under a thumbtack.

npcs.name: Hector
npcs.dialogue: One day the balloons will lift us above all this noise.
npcs.flavor: He stares at the sky as if it might finally lift him away.

world.name: VFD Village: Council Hall
world.description: Long benches, stern portraits, and a bell that rings more often than it is needed.

items.name: Gavel
items.notice: A scuffed dais in VFD Village: Council Hall reveals a neglected Gavel beneath the bench.

items.name: Rulebook
items.notice: A scuffed dais in VFD Village: Council Hall reveals a neglected Rulebook beneath the bench.

world.name: VFD Village: Jailhouse
world.description: Iron bars and a key that is always missing when justice is required.

items.name: Rusty Bars
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around VFD Village: Jailhouse, you notice a Rusty Bars where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Cotteny Blanket
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around VFD Village: Jailhouse, you notice a Cotteny Blanket where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: VFD Village: Hector’s House
world.description: A tinkerer’s paradise of balloons, contraptions, and blueprints for impossible freedom.

world.name: Hospital Drive
world.description: A bleak driveway edged with dying hedges and optimistic signage.

world.name: Heimlich: Lobby
world.description: Flickering fluorescents and pamphlets that cure nothing.

items.name: Visitor Badge
items.notice: A plastic Visitor Badge sits in a tray near the desk.

npcs.name: Bursar
npcs.flavor: One stamp in the wrong place and it’s the end of the world.

world.name: Heimlich: Records Library
world.description: Dust and index cards; the truth is filed under letters no one checks.

items.name: Index Card
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Heimlich: Records Library, you notice the edge of a Index Card that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

items.name: Patient File
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Heimlich: Records Library, you notice the edge of a Patient File that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

items.name: Employee Badge
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Heimlich: Records Library, you notice a Employee Badge where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Maintenance Badge
items.notice: You notice a Maintenance Badge tucked where anyone might find it.

world.name: Heimlich: Operating Theater
world.description: Sharp lights, sharper tools, and a curtain people hide behind when they ought to leave.

world.name: Heimlich: Rooftop
world.description: Gravel, exhaust vents, and a long way down.

world.name: Desert Road
world.description: A ribbon of dust leading to a carnival that pretends to be cheerful and mountains that do not pretend at all.

world.name: Caligari: Big Top
world.description: A tent of faded stripes and forced applause.

world.name: Caligari: House of Freaks
world.description: A drafty side tent where kindness is an act and cruelty is the audience.

world.name: Caligari: Fortune Teller Tent
world.description: Madame Lulu’s perfumed drapery and a crystal ball that knows only what it is told.

items.name: Tarot Card
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Caligari: Fortune Teller Tent, you notice a Tarot Card where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Ticket Stub
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Caligari: Fortune Teller Tent, you notice a Ticket Stub where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Donation Box
items.notice: Your foot bumps something solid in Caligari: Fortune Teller Tent; dust puffs up around a Donation Box hidden behind crates.

check.notes: Look behind crates and under furniture.

npcs.name: Madame Lulu
npcs.dialogue: People ask me many questions. I answer the ones they pay for.
npcs.flavor: Perfumed air and a pointed look suggest donations are appreciated.

world.name: Mountain Road
world.description: A switchback track littered with snowshoe prints and splinters of sleds.

world.name: Mortmain: Mountain Path
world.description: Ice-glazed ledges, rope bridges, and signs eaten by goats.

E.blocked_text: Beyond this point is pitch-dark; without a reliable light source, moving forward would be reckless.

items.name: Climbing Rope
items.notice: A scuff mark on the floor of Mortmain: Mountain Path leads your eyes to the Climbing Rope propped against the wall.

items.name: Snow Goggles
items.notice: A scuff mark on the floor of Mortmain: Mountain Path leads your eyes to the Snow face shield propped against the wall.

items.name: Rope Coil
items.notice: You notice a Rope Coil tucked where anyone might find it.

items.name: Headlamp
items.notice: A battered Headlamp hangs from a trail marker.

world.name: Clustered Pines
world.description: Trees clustered so tight they gossip in scrapes; headlamp light barely fits between trunks.

items.name: Lantern
items.notice: While adjusting to the light in Clustered Pines, you spot a headlamp hanging from a hook near the shadows.

items.name: Oil Flask
items.notice: While adjusting to the light in Clustered Pines, you spot a Oil Flask hanging from a hook near the shadows.

items.name: Rust Seal
items.notice: Hidden in a hollow trunk, a carved seal pulses faintly with old V.F.D. marks.

world.name: Snow Scouts: Camp
world.description: Neat rows of tents with badges for nearly everything but bravery.

S.blocked_text: Beyond this point is pitch-dark; without a reliable light source, moving forward would be reckless.

items.name: Headlamp
items.notice: A battered Headlamp hangs from a trail marker, just before the dark stretch ahead.

world.name: Mount Fraught: Vantage
world.description: A ledge that sees too much: valleys of smoke, eagles, and misfortune.

world.name: Stricken Stream: Dock
world.description: A wavering pier over waters that look clean and aren’t.

world.name: Queequeg: Control Room
world.description: Periscopes, valves, and a logbook of disasters narrowly avoided.

items.name: Safety Hardhat
items.notice: A scuff mark on the floor of Queequeg: Control Room leads your eyes to the Safety Hardhat propped against the wall.

items.name: Compressed Air Tank
items.notice: A scuff mark on the floor of Queequeg: Control Room leads your eyes to the Compressed Air Tank propped against the wall.

items.name: Logbook
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Queequeg: Control Room, you notice a Logbook where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

items.name: Old Safety Hardhat
items.notice: You notice a Old Safety Hardhat tucked where anyone might find it.

items.name: Compressed Air Tank
items.notice: You notice a Compressed Air Tank tucked where anyone might find it.

world.name: Queequeg: Galley
world.description: A tiny kitchen where soup sloshes with each turn of the propeller.

world.name: Queequeg: Bunks
world.description: Narrow bunks that insist on dreams about drowning.

world.name: Gorgonian sump
world.description: An underwater cave whose spores do not accept apologies.

items.name: Medusoid Mycelium
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Gorgonian sump, you notice a Medusoid Mycelium where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Hotel: Drive
world.description: A sweeping drive that reflects the building twice—once in the puddles and once in your doubts.

world.name: Hotel: Lobby
world.description: Mirrored walls, mirrored guests, and mirrored intentions.

items.name: Lantern
items.notice: You notice a headlamp tucked where anyone might find it.

items.name: Master Key (Spare)
items.notice: A brass key on a worn tag reads MASTER.

world.name: Hotel: Laundry
world.description: Hot, damp air and sheets that try to hide messages.

world.name: Hotel: Sauna
world.description: Steam thick enough to swallow secrets whole.

world.name: Hotel: Rooftop
world.description: Sun loungers, signaling flags, and a view of fires yet to start.

world.name: Hotel: Basement Library
world.description: An index by water and a catalog by courage.

items.name: Index Drawer Key
items.notice: As you test a loose drawer in Hotel: Basement Library, a glint catches your eye—the Index Drawer Key wedged beneath the track.

check.notes: Listen and feel for hidden catches and false bottoms.

items.name: Catalog Map
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Hotel: Basement Library, you notice the edge of a Catalog Map that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

npcs.name: Dewey Denouement
npcs.dialogue: The catalog is a living thing. Treat it kindly.
npcs.flavor: He relaxes when you keep your voice down and your citations up.

world.name: lake Route
world.description: A treacherous span of open water plied by dinghies and dubious moral lessons.

world.name: Island: lakeshore
world.description: White sand, pale sun, and the squeak of sandals avoiding responsibility.

world.name: Island: Colony Tent
world.description: A communal tent where decisions are made by the loudest cough.

world.name: Island: Ishmael’s Hut
world.description: A clay chair, a robe, and the soft authority of someone who says ‘we don’t do that here’.

world.name: Island: Orchard
world.description: Twisted trees heavy with apples that cure and cause in equal measure.

world.name: Rust Junction Station
world.description: A forlorn platform where trains pause out of habit more than schedule.

world.name: Foundry Row (Rust)
world.description: Shuttered storefronts, creaking signs, and the smell of ink even where ink should not be.

world.name: The Iron Arms: Lobby
world.description: A crumbling foyer with a guestbook that contains more rumors than names.

items.name: Attic Key
items.notice: As you test a loose drawer in The Iron Arms: Lobby, a glint catches your eye—the Attic Key wedged beneath the track.

check.notes: Listen and feel for hidden catches and false bottoms.

items.name: Spare Locker Key
items.notice: You notice a Spare Locker Key tucked where anyone might find it.

items.name: Oil Flask
items.notice: You notice a Oil Flask tucked where anyone might find it.

world.name: The Iron Arms: Room
world.description: Peeling wallpaper, creaky bed, suitcase on a chair, hope on the floor.

world.name: Copper Mug Café
world.description: Clinking cups, a scratched counter, and conversations that dodge the truth.

U.blocked_text: A small panel awaits a Silver Access Button press—it clicks invitingly.

items.name: To-Go Mug
items.notice: The smell in Copper Mug Café is unmistakable—you trace it to a To-Go Mug set just out of sight.

items.name: Receipt Book
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Copper Mug Café, you notice the edge of a Receipt Book that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

items.name: Silver Access Button
items.notice: A nickel-sized Silver Access Button is tucked beneath the counter lip.

world.name: Rust Refinery: Factory Floor
world.description: Vats the size of secrets and catwalks that never quite meet in the middle.

items.name: Grease Canister
items.notice: A chemical tang in Rust Refinery: Factory Floor draws you to a shelf where a Grease Canister sits half-concealed.

check.notes: Chemical smell or labels can guide you.

items.name: Safety Goggles
items.notice: A scuff mark on the floor of Rust Refinery: Factory Floor leads your eyes to the Safety face shield propped against the wall.

world.name: Company Clinic: Ward
world.description: Quiet halls where prescriptions are written in code.

world.name: Copperview Children’s Home
world.description: An orphanage that prefers order to children.

world.name: Brassgate Manor: Ballroom
world.description: A grand room gone threadbare, chandelier crystals missing like extracted teeth.

world.name: Brassgate Manor: Study
world.description: Curtains drawn, ledgers locked, and the sense that a statue is always missing.

items.name: Missing Ledger Slot
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Brassgate Manor: Study, you notice the edge of a Missing logbook Slot that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

items.name: Sealed Envelope
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Brassgate Manor: Study, you notice a Sealed Envelope where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Brassgate Manor: Cellar
world.description: Damp steps, crates, and a draft that smells like the lake that left.

world.name: Rust Public Library
world.description: Stacks tied with string and a circulation desk that survived three collapses.

items.name: Maintenance Manual
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Rust Public Library, you notice the edge of a Maintenance Manual that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

items.name: Ciphered Message
items.notice: Taking a moment to look around Rust Public Library, you notice a Ciphered Message where the dust doesn’t settle quite right.

world.name: Industrial Heritage Museum
world.description: Display cases of curiosities culminating in a plinth that remembers the Bombinating Beast.

items.name: Foundry Plinth
items.notice: The emptiness of a display in Industrial Heritage Museum betrays a Foundry Plinth with scratched corners.

items.name: Display Key
items.notice: As you test a loose drawer in Industrial Heritage Museum, a glint catches your eye—the Display Key wedged beneath the track.

check.notes: Listen and feel for hidden catches and false bottoms.

world.name: Rust Constabulary
world.description: A desk, a whistle, and a handbook of errors.

npcs.name: Constable Pair
npcs.dialogue: Paperwork first, justice later. Usually much later.
npcs.flavor: They trust paperwork and nothing else—especially not you.

world.name: Rust Stationers
world.description: A stationery shop selling the tools of truth and excellent lies.

world.name: Abandoned Quarry Pit
world.description: The drained lakebed—a cracked plain of salt and ropes, where boats sit like fossils.

world.name: Ore Tramline
world.description: A winding footpath of boards and ropes crossing the Maw to the far edges of town.

world.name: Unmarked Coach Road
world.description: Rutted earth road used by theatrical troupes and worse, threading between distant towns.

world.name: Copper Mug Café: Attic
world.description: A low, dust-sweet space of rafters, burlap coffee sacks, and a dormer window overlooking the shale flats. Hidden ledgers are known to slip between floorboards.

items.name: Bag of House Roast
items.notice: The smell in Copper Mug Café: Attic is unmistakable—you trace it to a Bag of House Roast set just out of sight.

items.name: Shift Logbook
items.notice: Leafing through a stack of papers in Copper Mug Café: Attic, you notice the edge of a Shift Logbook that doesn’t quite match the others.

check.notes: Sorting papers, checking spines and misfiled edges helps.

items.name: Dusty Trunk
items.notice: Your foot bumps something solid in Copper Mug Café: Attic; dust puffs up around a Dusty Trunk hidden behind crates.

check.notes: Look behind crates and under furniture.

items.name: Logbook Page
items.notice: You notice a Logbook Page tucked where anyone might find it.

npcs.name: Ellington Feint
npcs.dialogue: Secrets stain worse than ink. Do you have what I asked for?
npcs.flavor: A raised eyebrow says she already knows your secrets; she just wants proof.

world.name: The City: Smithson Block
world.description: A quiet block of narrow townhouses, cats on windowsills, and a newspaper stand that never closes.

items.name: Newspaper
items.notice: You notice a Newspaper nearby.

items.name: Umbrella
items.notice: You notice a Umbrella nearby.

world.name: Smithson Home: Front Room
world.description: A tidy room with a low sofa and a shelf of mystery novels with penciled annotations.

items.name: House Key
items.notice: You notice a House Key nearby.

items.name: Penciled Novel
items.notice: You notice a Penciled Novel nearby.

world.name: Smithson Home: Study
world.description: A neat desk, a locked drawer, and a pinboard laced with red thread connecting names.

items.name: Pinned Clue
items.notice: You notice a Pinned Clue nearby.

items.name: Drawer Key
items.notice: You notice a Drawer Key nearby.

npcs.name: Quiet Neighbor
npcs.dialogue: I’m just returning this… unless you want to trade clues.
npcs.flavor: Appears whenever the kettle whistles, disappears when you ask for a name.

world.name: Neighborhood Well
world.description: An old stone well with a squeaky pulley and a bucket that’s heavier than it looks.

items.name: Old Coin
items.notice: You notice a Old Coin nearby.

items.name: Bucket
items.notice: You notice a Bucket nearby.

world.name: City Museum
world.description: A cross between a curiosity cabinet and public school exhibit—glass cases, dusty plaques, and a helpful docent.

items.name: Audio Guide
items.notice: You notice a Audio Guide nearby.

items.name: Map Brochure
items.notice: You notice a Map Brochure nearby.

npcs.name: Docent
npcs.dialogue: If you’d like a tour, press the green button. If you hear a buzzing, that was the wrong button.
npcs.flavor: She knows every dusty corner and loves a good question.

world.name: Rust: Power Substation (Exterior)
world.description: A squat concrete building marooned on the shale flats. The doorway is ajar and the lintel bears eight faint pictographs: a key, a badge, a headlamp, a coil of rope, face shield, a hardhat, a scroll stamped with a seal, and an open logbook.

items.name: Chalk Rubbing of Pictographs
items.notice: You notice a Chalk Rubbing of Pictographs nearby.

items.name: Brass Socket Diagram
items.notice: The diagram is bolted beside the door, its symbols rubbed almost smooth by the wind.

world.name: Rust: Substation Antechamber
world.description: A circular room hums with dormant power. Around the bulkhead, eight brass sockets match the pictographs outside. Each socket bears a symbol hinting at what appeases it: lock, staff sigil, flame, knot, snowburst, safety bell, warrant seal, logbook mark.

IN.blocked_text: The bulkhead stays dark. Around its rim, the eight sockets remain unlit: a suitable key, staff credentials, a living light, climbing rig, cold-weather face shield, a Respirator Rig, a signed permit, and a logbook entry.

world.name: Rust: Parallel Substation Portal
world.description: The air ripples like heat above pavement. A ring of mirrors shows a version of you that is very nearly you. Step through to return where you began—though something important will be different.

OUT.blocked_text: The bulkhead stays dark. Around its rim, the eight sockets remain unlit: a suitable key, staff credentials, a living light, climbing rig, cold-weather face shield, a Respirator Rig, a signed permit, and a logbook entry.

world.name: Rust: Lost & Found Kiosk
world.description: A plywood kiosk with a hand-painted sign: LOST (and sometimes FOUND). A slatted counter displays a jumble of civic detritus.

items.name: Spare Locker Key

meta.note: Graph designed for traversal; exits use direction strings mapping to integer ids.

search_checks.advantage_rule: If player inventory grants any type listed in advantage_if_types, roll with advantage or reduce DC in your system.
search_checks.notes: Item objects include a 'check' field with {skill, dc, advantage_if_types, disadvantage_if_missing_types, notes}.

meta.exit_blocked_text: Each exit object includes a 'blocked_text' shown when requirements are not met.

parallel_portal.on_enter_behavior: Return player to their ORIGINAL starting room (engine should override the destination id) and assign a new secret objective tracked out-of-band.
